Key Match Events: Jude Bellingham scored in the 95th minute to salvage a 2-2 draw for England against Belgium.
Youri Tielemans scored twice before half-time to give Belgium a 2-0 lead.
Ivan Toney scored his first England goal from the penalty spot to equalise in the first half.
Pre-Game Insights: England were without several first-choice names due to an injury crisis.
Gareth Southgate will name a 23-player squad for the European Championship in Germany this summer.
Post-Match Reflections: Jude Bellingham's late equaliser spared Gareth Southgate's blushes of suffering back-to-back home defeats.
Ivan Toney expressed hope that he had made an impression with his performance.
Kobbie Mainoo's debut was praised by Bellingham, who said he was a 'brilliant player'.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kobbie Mainoo, 18, made his full international debut for England and was named player of the match.
The game was played on a heavy, damp pitch at Wembley.
The England team dominated the game but found it difficult to score goals.
Others: England's next game is not mentioned in the article.
